title: Novak Djokovic Set to Play Fellow Serb in Australian Open as Visa Decision Looms; No. 1 men's tennis player waits to hear whether immigration minister would use his power to cancel his visa
text:
A day earlier, Djokovic said his agent made an error on a travel declarationused to enter Australia last week. He also said he attended an interview and photo shoot in Belgrade, Serbia, last month after receiving a positive test result for Covid-19.

"These are personal ministerial powers able to be exercised by Minister Hawke and I don't propose to make any further comment at this time," Prime Minister Scott Morrison said at a Thursday news conference in Canberra.

The government canceled Djokovic's visa shortly after his arrival in Australia last week, although it was reinstated by a judge on Monday because immigration authorities didn't give him enough time to respond to a notice that the visa would be canceled.

Write to Stuart Condie at stuart.condie@wsj.com

Novak Djokovic Set to Play Fellow Serb in Australian Open as Visa Decision Looms
